channel.title: Jailbreak your iphone/ipod touch
channel.description:
Extremely simple guide. Visit: http://jailbreakme.com in the browser of the device you want to jailbreak. There will be a slider bar, slide this accross and after a short wait your device will be jailbroken. Please note:
Firstly, don't update past 4.0.1, the last firmware JailbreakMe supports. Secondly, and arguably most importantly, allow Cydia to "make your life easier". This will allow you to always restore back to the latest firmware available when you select that option.

item.title: Jailbreak your iphone/ipod touch
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

mapu:

Sanga, if there was a point to postin a tut of the older, harder ways to jailbreak then i would have posted one. Nowadays it’s easy as pie so take the carrot out of your ass. You’re full of yourself

if someone cant figure out how to slide a slider across on the web they suck. Like i said explain the email method or the iBooks method then its a tutorial

Read full topic

item.title: Jailbreak your iphone/ipod touch
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“eczema3, post:7, topic:357727”][quote author=sanga282 link=topic=454242.msg3326811#msg3326811 date=1283165859]
this also doesnt need a tutorial, its sliding a bar across in a web browser, if you’d shown the email method or the iBooks method then maybe but this is pointless.

What are the consequences of jailbreaking your phone?

Also if people are on 4.0.2 and have an iphone 3G or iPod touch 2G or earlier you can downgrade because there is no firmware signing by apple, if you have a newer device you’d need to have backed up your SHSH’s either using cydia or tinyumbrella to downgrade
[/quote]
False. I have a 2nd Generation ipod touch and I cannot downgrade without my SHSH blobs.[/quote]
rly? afaik they didnt need signing on the older devices
EDIT: found this

[QUOTE=defakadef]I Know Most People Want To Downgrade Their Ipod Or Iphone To 3.1.2
YOU DONT NEED SHSH BLOBS OR EDIT THE HOST FILE
The Firmware Is Already Jailbroken
THIS APPLIES TO
IPHONE 2G
IPHONE 3G
IPHONE 3GS
IPOD 2G MB

IPHONE USERS ASK FOR A FIRMWARE THAT IS ACTIVATED OR NON ACTIVATED
IPOD TOUCH 2G MB USER WILL HAVE 200MB IN VM INSTEAD OF 80

FIRST - You Must Be JailBroken On Ios4 If Your Not Then Find The Simpleliest Way To Jailbeak it

Second - Just Google For Links to Firmware It Will Be Three Firmwares Parts Just Extract All 3 Parts to One Folder And It Should Come Out To 1 Firmware

Third - Put Your Ipod In Recovery Mode (Just Turn Off Device And Unplug It Then Hold The Home Button Then Plug it in You Should Be In Recovery Mode

Fourth - Your Device Should Show Up In Recovery Mode Now Hold Shift And Click Restore (Mac User Hold Command) Choose The The Firmware You Extracted And Let iTunes Do The Rest

Pm Me Say Thanks if it Works
No 3194 Error
Good Luck;)[/QUOTE]
i havn’t got an older (working) device to test it on

Read full topic

item.title: Jailbreak your iphone/ipod touch
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

[quote=“sanga282, post:6, topic:357727”]this also doesnt need a tutorial, its sliding a bar across in a web browser, if you’d shown the email method or the iBooks method then maybe but this is pointless.

What are the consequences of jailbreaking your phone?

Also if people are on 4.0.2 and have an iphone 3G or iPod touch 2G or earlier you can downgrade because there is no firmware signing by apple, if you have a newer device you’d need to have backed up your SHSH’s either using cydia or tinyumbrella to downgrade[/quote]
False. I have a 2nd Generation ipod touch and I cannot downgrade without my SHSH blobs.

Read full topic

item.title: Jailbreak your iphone/ipod touch
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

this also doesnt need a tutorial, its sliding a bar across in a web browser, if you’d shown the email method or the iBooks method then maybe but this is pointless.

Radeon:

What are the consequences of jailbreaking your phone?

just lack of warranty, potential software bugs but they are normally not too bad obviously different packages come with their own bugs but jailbreaking itself is fairly safe. Also if people are on 4.0.2 and have an iphone 3G or iPod touch 2G or earlier you can downgrade because there is no firmware signing by apple, if you have a newer device you’d need to have backed up your SHSH’s either using cydia or tinyumbrella to downgrade

Read full topic

item.title: Jailbreak your iphone/ipod touch
item.dc:creator: @mapu mapu
item.description:
@mapu wrote:

Thug-life:

http://jailbreakme.com was blocked by 4.0.2. Also, you can restore your phone through iTunes and it’ll be like it never happened, so your warranty stays intact.

I figured as much. I thought they could log it or something though. Can anybody verify that a restore will work without backlogging your jailbreak?

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @mapu mapu

Radeon:

What are the consequences of jailbreaking your phone?

You lose your warranty.

But you get free apps/can customize basicly everything on your phone so it’s worth it.
